# The `WindowScheduler` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

The main class in the implementation of the target independent window scheduler. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

The main class in the implementation of the target independent window scheduler.

Definition at line 61 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/windowscheduler-h">WindowScheduler.h</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/windowscheduler-h/#l00082">82</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/windowscheduler-h">WindowScheduler.h</a>.

### TripleDAG {#aabfa4ddad621932351b720f8162030e8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;ScheduleDAGInstrs&gt; llvm::WindowScheduler::TripleDAG</>}
  labels = {["protected"]}>
To innovatively identify the dependencies between MIs across two trips, we construct a DAG for a new MBB, which is created by copying the original MBB three times.

We refer to this new MBB as &#39;TripleMBB&#39; and the corresponding DAG as &#39;TripleDAG&#39;. If the dependencies are more than two trips, we avoid applying window algorithm by identifying successive phis in the old MBB.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/windowscheduler-h/#l00078">78</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/windowscheduler-h">WindowScheduler.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### TriToOri {#a7e8c400b0b728b6ec230f0b487c6af44}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>DenseMap&lt;MachineInstr &#42;, MachineInstr &#42;&gt; llvm::WindowScheduler::TriToOri</>}
  labels = {["protected"]}>
TriToOri keeps the mappings between the MI clones in TripleMBB and their original MI.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/windowscheduler-h/#l00085">85</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/windowscheduler-h">WindowScheduler.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
